thread.title: The Worst Tickets at the Winter Olympics

author: Sara Germano
title: The Worst Tickets at the Winter Olympics
text:
PYEONGCHANG, South Koreaâ€”The South Korean government spent $107 million to build a brand-new sliding center for the Winter Olympics. Spectators who traveled the world to see luge in person here on a recent night spent perhaps a second watching each entrant fly by.
The finish line seating bowl at the Olympic Sliding Center, where luge, bobsled, and skeleton take place, might be the worst ticket at the Olympics, as measured by actual time spent viewing competition in progress.
